title: Mana Vamp Scepter concept (Essence scepter)
body: Essence reaver as everyone knows is an item that is only built very situationally, and i have never seen it built in a pro game. It is a good idea for an item because it greatly boosts the laning ability of mana reliant champions such as jayce and ezreal. But it is usually never completed before laning is over, so usually tear is built instead. My idea is for it to have a new build path with a new item. Which behaves exactly like a vamp sceper but it returns mana instead. And the new essence reaver would be built from an essence scepter(working title), a vamp scepter and a pickaxe. This would also give a choice of what the player wants to buikd first( damage, hp sustain or mana sustain).

replies.body:
Essence Reaver costs too much for what it does. By the time you get enough money for it, you usually don't have mana problems anymore.

I had a few ideas for it. Much like you, Pickaxe + Vamp is an obvious change they can make. Just reduce the AD, make it cheaper, might be a good "snowballing" item.

What I also thought, was MAYBE, since they changed Blackcleaver, change Reaver to Brutuliser + Vamp. Take away some AD but adds amour pen.
It originally did build from pickaxe + vamp with less AD/cost. No one bought it because the AD was too low to justify taking up item slot later in the game
The Essence Reaver is somewhat in the same boat as Ohmwrecker, too situational to give up an item slot for most of the time.
I've yet to see an anti-tower/tower dive comp with {{champion:268}}, {{champion:432}} and {{item:3056}}.
Essence reaver isn't built because it's a terrible item, not because it can't be completed before the end of laning phase.

It's under-powering, yes.

And, I'm pretty sure {{item:3004}} and {{item:3042}} scale far better into late game once you have all the mana stacks.
